column4: hi all. trying to put ubuntu on a thinkpad 600, it says invalid compression error 2 and kernel panic is there a way to simply install it to the drive without ahveing to load it into memory or some other work around?
Yes, use the alternate install CD.  But I can't promise it'll work any better when you go to start it.
It should be around the same place you find the normal CD.  I'll try and locate the page, but my internets are slow.
